name: One-Bottle Vermouth Sangria
description: The world’s easiest sangria recipe skips the basic red wine, brandy, and liqueur and opts instead for sweet vermouth and fresh summer fruit.
ingredients: 8 oz. fresh or frozen fruit (such as cherries, raspberries, blackberries,  and/or sliced peaches)
1 375-ml bottle sweet vermouth (such  as Carpano Antica)
½ cup (or more) fresh lemon juice
instructions: Gently stir 8 oz. fresh or frozen fruit (such as cherries, raspberries, blackberries, and/or sliced peaches), one 375-ml bottle sweet vermouth, ½ cup fresh lemon juice, and ½ cup fresh orange juice in a large pitcher to combine. Add ice to fill pitcher and pour in 1½ cups chilled club soda. Taste sangria and add more lemon juice or club soda if needed. Do Ahead: Sangria (without ice and club soda) can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill. Add ice and club soda just before serving.
